00056 /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00057 /* FUNCTION  recreate_cfg_objects():                                            */
00058 /* It re-creates Configuration Objects from file cfg.bin if the ./server        */
00059 /* program is stopped abruptly. It internally calls init_cfgparser()            */
00060 /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00061 
00062 
00063 void recreate_cfg_objects(){ 
00064 
00065 /* ---------------------------------------------------------------- */
00066 /*        Initialize Global Mutex Variable from global.h            */
00067 /* ---------------------------------------------------------------- */
00068         pthread_mutex_init(&mutex_file, NULL);
00069         pthread_mutex_init(&mutex_cfg, NULL);
00070         pthread_mutex_init(&mutex_status_change, NULL);
00071         pthread_mutex_init(&mutex_Lower_Layer_Details, NULL);
00072         pthread_mutex_init(&mutex_Upper_Layer_Details, NULL);
00073 //      fp_sorted = fopen ("sorted.txt","a");
00074 
00075 //      PDC_IDCODE = 100;
00076 
00077         CMDSYNC[0] = 0xaa;
00078         CMDSYNC[1] = 0x41;
00079         CMDSYNC[2] = '\0';
00080         
00081         CMDCFGSEND[0] = 0x00;
00082         CMDCFGSEND[1] = 0x05;
00083         CMDCFGSEND[2] = '\0'; 
00084 
00085         CMDDATASEND[0] = 0x00;
00086         CMDDATASEND[1] = 0x02;
00087         CMDDATASEND[2] = '\0'; 
00088 
00089         CMDDATAOFF[0] = 0x00;
00090         CMDDATAOFF[1] = 0x01;
00091         CMDDATAOFF[2] = '\0'; 
00092 
00093         DATASYNC[0] = 0xaa;
00094         DATASYNC[1] = 0x01;
00095         DATASYNC[2] = '\0';
00096 
00097         CFGSYNC[0] = 0xaa;
00098         CFGSYNC[1] = 0x31;
00099         CFGSYNC[2] = '\0';
00100 
00101         int yes =1;
00102 
00103         /* Create UDP socket for DB Server and bind to DBPORT */
00104 
00105         if ((DB_sockfd = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_DGRAM, 0)) == -1) {
00106 
00107                  perror("socket");
00108                  exit(1);
00109 
00110         } else {
00111 
00112                 printf("DB Socket:Sucessfully created\n");
00113         
00114         }       
00115         if (setsockopt(DB_sockfd,SOL_SOCKET,SO_REUSEADDR,&yes,sizeof(int)) == -1) {
00116                 perror("setsockopt");
00117                 exit(1);
00118         }
00119 
00120         bzero(&DB_Server_addr,sizeof(DB_Server_addr));
00121         DB_Server_addr.sin_family = AF_INET;            // host byte order
00122         DB_Server_addr.sin_port = htons(DBPORT);       // short, network byte order
00123         DB_Server_addr.sin_addr.s_addr = inet_addr(dbserver_ip);    // automatically fill with my IP
00124         memset(&(DB_Server_addr.sin_zero),'\0', 8);     // zero the rest of the struct
00125 
00126 
00127         /* Create CFG Objects from cfg.bin*/
00128 
00129         static const char filename[] = "cfg.bin";        
00130         FILE *file = fopen (filename,"rb");
00131 
00132         unsigned char *line,frame_len[2];
00133         unsigned int framesize;
00134         unsigned long fileLen;
00135 
00136         if (file != NULL) {
00137 
00138                         //Get file length
00139                         fseek(file, 0, SEEK_END);
00140                         fileLen = ftell(file);
00141                         fseek(file, 0, SEEK_SET);
00142                         printf("FILE LEN LEFT %ld\n",fileLen);
00143                         printf("Creating objects for entries in cfg.bin\n");
00144 
00145                         while (fileLen != 0) /* Till the EOF */{
00146 
00147                                 fseek (file,2 ,SEEK_CUR);
00148                                 fread(frame_len, sizeof(unsigned char),2, file);
00149                                 fseek (file,-4 ,SEEK_CUR);
00150                                 
00151                                 framesize = to_intconvertor(frame_len);
00152                                 line = malloc(framesize*sizeof(unsigned char));
00153                                 memset(line,'\0',sizeof(line));
00154 
00155                                 fread(line, sizeof(unsigned char),framesize,file);
00156                                 init_cfgparser(line);
00157                                 free(line);
00158                                 fileLen -= framesize;
00159                         }
00160                         fclose (file);
00161 
00162         } else {
00163                         perror (filename); /* why didn't the file open? */
00164         }
00165 
00166 }

00169 /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00170 /* FUNCTION  init_cfgparser():                                                  */
00171 /* It is called by recreate_cfg_object() to read the file `cfg.bin`             */
00172 /* and create cfg objects in the memory                                         */
00173 /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00174 
00175 void init_cfgparser(unsigned char st[]){ 
00176 
00177         unsigned char *s;
00178         unsigned int phn,ann,dgn,num_pmu;
00179         int i,j,dgchannels;
00180         struct cfg_frame *cfg;
00181         struct channel_names *cn;
00182 
00183 /******************** PARSING BEGINGS *******************/
00184 
00185           cfg = malloc(sizeof(struct cfg_frame));
00186           if(!cfg) {
00187                 fprintf(fp_log,"Not enough memory for cfg\n");
00188           }
00189 
00190           s = st;
00191                    
00192           // Memory Allocation Begins
00193 
00194           // Allocate memory to framesize
00195           cfg->framesize = malloc(3*sizeof(unsigned char));
00196           if(!cfg->framesize) {
00197                 printf("Not enough memory for cfg->framesize\n");
00198           }
00199 
00200           // Allocate memory to idcode
00201           cfg->idcode = malloc(3*sizeof(unsigned char));
00202           if(!cfg->idcode) {
00203                 printf("Not enough memory for cfg->framesize\n");
00204           }
00205 
00206           // Allocate memory to soc
00207           cfg->soc = malloc(5*sizeof(unsigned char));
00208           if(!cfg->soc) {
00209                 printf("Not enough memory for cfg->soc\n");
00210           }
00211 
00212           // Allocate memory to fracsec
00213           cfg->fracsec = malloc(5*sizeof(unsigned char));
00214           if(!cfg->fracsec) {
00215                 printf("Not enough memory for cfg->fracsec\n");
00216           }
00217 
00218           // Allocate memory to time_base
00219           cfg->time_base = malloc(5*sizeof(unsigned char));
00220           if(!cfg->time_base) {
00221                 printf("Not enough memory for cfg->time_base\n");
00222           }
00223 
00224           // Allocate memory to num_pmu
00225           cfg->num_pmu = malloc(3*sizeof(unsigned char));
00226           if(!cfg->num_pmu) {
00227                 printf("Not enough memory for cfg->num_pmu\n");
00228           }
00229 
00230           // Allocate memory to data_rate
00231           cfg->data_rate = malloc(3*sizeof(unsigned char));
00232           if(!cfg->data_rate) {
00233                 printf("Not enough memory for cfg->data_rate\n");
00234           }
00235 
00236         // Skip the sync word
00237            s = s + 2;   
00238 
00239         // Separate the FRAME SIZE
00240           copy_cbyc (cfg->framesize,(unsigned char *)s,2);
00241           cfg->framesize[2]='\0';
00242           s = s + 2;
00243                 
00244          //SEPARATE IDCODE
00245           copy_cbyc (cfg->idcode,(unsigned char *)s,2);
00246           cfg->idcode[2]='\0';
00247           int id = to_intconvertor(cfg->idcode);
00248           printf("ID Code %d\n",id);
00249           s = s + 2;
00250 
00251           //SEPARATE SOC
00252           copy_cbyc (cfg->soc,(unsigned char *)s,4);
00253           cfg->soc[4]='\0';
00254           s = s + 4;
00255 
00256           //SEPARATE FRACSEC
00257           copy_cbyc (cfg->fracsec,(unsigned char *)s,4);
00258           cfg->fracsec[4]='\0';
00259           s = s + 4;
00260 
00261           //SEPARATE TIMEBASE
00262           copy_cbyc (cfg->time_base,(unsigned char *)s,4);
00263           cfg->time_base[4]='\0';
00264           s = s + 4;
00265         
00266           //SEPARATE PMU NUM
00267           copy_cbyc (cfg->num_pmu,(unsigned char *)s,2);
00268           cfg->num_pmu[2]='\0';
00269           s = s + 2;    
00270 
00271           num_pmu = to_intconvertor(cfg->num_pmu);
00272           printf("No of PMU %d\n",num_pmu);
00273           fprintf(fp_log,"INT No of PMU %d\n",num_pmu);
00274 
00275           // Allocate Memeory For Each PMU
00276           cfg->pmu = malloc(num_pmu* sizeof(struct for_each_pmu *));
00277           if(!cfg->pmu) {
00278               printf("Not enough memory pmu[][]\n");
00279               exit(1);
00280           }
00281         
00282           for (i = 0; i < num_pmu; i++) {
00283               cfg->pmu[i] = malloc(sizeof(struct for_each_pmu));
00284           }
00285         
00286          j = 0;
00287                 
00289           while(j<num_pmu) {
00290 
00291                  // Memory Allocation for stn
00292                   cfg->pmu[j]->stn = malloc(17*sizeof(unsigned char));
00293                   if(!cfg->pmu[j]->stn) {
00294                       printf("Not enough memory cfg->pmu[j]->stn\n");
00295                       exit(1);
00296                   }
00297 
00298                  // Memory Allocation for idcode
00299                   cfg->pmu[j]->idcode = malloc(3*sizeof(unsigned char));
00300                   if(!cfg->pmu[j]->idcode) {
00301                       printf("Not enough memory cfg->pmu[j]->idcode\n");
00302                       exit(1);
00303                   }
00304 
00305                  // Memory Allocation for format
00306                   cfg->pmu[j]->data_format = malloc(3*sizeof(unsigned char));
00307                   if(!cfg->pmu[j]->data_format) {
00308                       printf("Not enough memory cfg->pmu[j]->data_format\n");
00309                       exit(1);
00310                   }
00311 
00312                  // Memory Allocation for phnmr
00313                   cfg->pmu[j]->phnmr = malloc(3*sizeof(unsigned char));
00314                   if(!cfg->pmu[j]->phnmr) {
00315                       printf("Not enough memory cfg->pmu[j]->phnmr\n");
00316                       exit(1);
00317                   }
00318 
00319                  // Memory Allocation for annmr
00320                   cfg->pmu[j]->annmr = malloc(3*sizeof(unsigned char));
00321                   if(!cfg->pmu[j]->annmr) {
00322                       printf("Not enough memory cfg->pmu[j]->annmr\n");
00323                       exit(1);
00324                   }
00325 
00326                  // Memory Allocation for dgnmr
00327                   cfg->pmu[j]->dgnmr = malloc(3*sizeof(unsigned char));
00328                   if(!cfg->pmu[j]->dgnmr) {
00329                       printf("Not enough memory cfg->pmu[j]->dgnmr\n");
00330                       exit(1);
00331                   }
00332 
00333                  // Memory Allocation for fnom
00334                   cfg->pmu[j]->fnom = malloc(3*sizeof(unsigned char));
00335                   if(!cfg->pmu[j]->fnom) {
00336                       printf("Not enough memory cfg->pmu[j]->fnom\n");
00337                       exit(1);
00338                   }
00339 
00340                  // Memory Allocation for cfg_cnt
00341                   cfg->pmu[j]->cfg_cnt = malloc(3*sizeof(unsigned char));
00342                   if(!cfg->pmu[j]->cfg_cnt) {
00343                       printf("Not enough memory cfg->pmu[j]->cfg_cnt\n");
00344                       exit(1);
00345                   }
00346 
00347 
00348                   //SEPARATE STATION NAME
00349                   copy_cbyc (cfg->pmu[j]->stn,(unsigned char *)s,16);
00350                   cfg->pmu[j]->stn[16]='\0';
00351                   s = s + 16;
00352 
00353                   //SEPARATE IDCODE             
00354                   copy_cbyc (cfg->pmu[j]->idcode,(unsigned char *)s,2);
00355                   cfg->pmu[j]->idcode[2]='\0';
00356                   s = s + 2;
00357         
00358                   //SEPARATE DATA FORMAT                
00359                   copy_cbyc (cfg->pmu[j]->data_format,(unsigned char *)s,2);
00360                   cfg->pmu[j]->data_format[2]='\0';
00361                   s = s + 2;    
00362         
00363                   // USE fmt
00364                   unsigned char hex = cfg->pmu[j]->data_format[1];
00365                   hex <<= 4;
00366                         
00367                   // Extra field has been added to identify polar,rectangular,floating/fixed point      
00368                   cfg->pmu[j]->fmt = malloc(sizeof(struct format));
00369                   if((hex & 0x80) == 0x80) cfg->pmu[j]->fmt->freq = '1'; else cfg->pmu[j]->fmt->freq = '0';
00370                   if((hex & 0x40) == 0x40 ) cfg->pmu[j]->fmt->analog = '1'; else cfg->pmu[j]->fmt->analog = '0';
00371                   if((hex & 0x20) == 0x20) cfg->pmu[j]->fmt->phasor = '1'; else cfg->pmu[j]->fmt->phasor = '0';
00372                   if((hex & 0x10) == 0x10) cfg->pmu[j]->fmt->polar =  '1'; else cfg->pmu[j]->fmt->polar = '0';
00373 
00374                   //SEPARATE PHASORS    
00375                   copy_cbyc (cfg->pmu[j]->phnmr,(unsigned char *)s,2);
00376                   cfg->pmu[j]->phnmr[2]='\0';
00377                   s = s + 2;
00378                   phn = to_intconvertor(cfg->pmu[j]->phnmr);
00379 
00380                   //SEPARATE ANALOGS                    
00381                   copy_cbyc (cfg->pmu[j]->annmr,(unsigned char *)s,2);
00382                   cfg->pmu[j]->annmr[2]='\0';
00383                   s = s + 2;
00384                   ann = to_intconvertor(cfg->pmu[j]->annmr);
00385                 
00386                   //SEPARATE DIGITALS                   
00387                   copy_cbyc (cfg->pmu[j]->dgnmr,(unsigned char *)s,2);
00388                   cfg->pmu[j]->dgnmr[2] = '\0';
00389                   s = s + 2; 
00390                   dgn = to_intconvertor(cfg->pmu[j]->dgnmr);
00391                   printf("Phasor %d Analogs %d Digitals %d\n",phn,ann,dgn);
00392         
00393                   cn = malloc(sizeof(struct channel_names));
00394                   if(!cn) {
00395                       printf("Not enough memory cn\n");
00396                       exit(1);
00397                   }
00398                   cn->first =  NULL;
00399 
00401                  if(phn != 0){
00402                            cn->phnames = malloc(phn*sizeof(unsigned char*));
00403                            if(!cn->phnames) {
00404                                    printf("Not enough memory cfg->pmu[j]->cn->phnames[][]\n");
00405                                    exit(1);
00406                            }
00407                 
00408                         for (i = 0; i < phn; i++) {
00409 
00410                                 cn->phnames[i] = malloc(17*sizeof(unsigned char));
00411 
00412                         }
00413                 
00414                         i = 0;//Index for PHNAMES
00415                         while(i<phn){
00416                                       copy_cbyc (cn->phnames[i],(unsigned char *)s,16);
00417                                       cn->phnames[i][16] = '\0';        
00418                                       printf("Phnames %s\n",cn->phnames[i]);
00419                                       s = s + 16;  
00420                                       i++;
00421                                       
00422                         }
00423                  } 
00424                 
00425                 //SEPARATE ANALOG NAMES
00426                  if(ann!=0){
00427                           cn->angnames = malloc(ann*sizeof(unsigned char*));
00428                           if(!cn->angnames) {
00429                                 printf("Not enough memory cfg->pmu[j]->cn->phnames[][]\n");
00430                                 exit(1);
00431                           }
00432                         
00433                           for (i = 0; i < ann; i++) {
00434 
00435                                 cn->angnames[i] = malloc(17*sizeof(unsigned char));
00436 
00437                           }
00438                         
00439                          
00440                           i=0;//Index for ANGNAMES
00441                         while(i<ann){
00442                                       copy_cbyc (cn->angnames[i],(unsigned char *)s,16);
00443                                       cn->angnames[i][16]='\0';
00444                                       printf("ANGNAMES %s\n",cn->angnames[i]);
00445                                       s =s + 16;  
00446                                       i++;                      
00447                         }
00448                  }
00449 
00450                  struct dgnames *q;
00451                  i = 0; //Index for number of dgwords
00452                  while(i<dgn) {
00453 
00454                         struct dgnames *temp1 = malloc(sizeof(struct dgnames));
00455 
00456                         temp1->dgn = malloc(16*sizeof(unsigned char *));
00457                                 
00458                           if(!temp1->dgn) {
00459                                 printf("Not enough memory temp1->dgn\n");
00460                                 exit(1);
00461                           }
00462 
00463                           for (i = 0; i < 16; i++) {
00464                                 temp1->dgn[i] = malloc(17*sizeof(unsigned char));
00465 
00466                           }
00467 
00468                         temp1->dg_next = NULL;
00469 
00470                         for(dgchannels=0;dgchannels<16;dgchannels++){
00471 
00472                                     copy_cbyc (temp1->dgn[dgchannels],(unsigned char *)s,16);
00473                                     temp1->dgn[dgchannels][16]='\0';
00474                                     s += 16;
00475                                     printf("%s\n",temp1->dgn[dgchannels]);
00476 
00477                         }
00478                           
00479                         if(cn->first == NULL){
00480                                 cn->first = q = temp1;
00481                         } else {
00482                                 while(q->dg_next!=NULL){
00483                                         q = q->dg_next;
00484                                 }
00485                                 q->dg_next = temp1;                            
00486                         }  
00487                         i++;  
00488                 } //DGWORD WHILE ENDS
00489 
00490                 cfg->pmu[j]->cnext = cn;//Assign to pointers
00491                 
00492                 
00494                 if(phn != 0){
00495                 
00496                         cfg->pmu[j]->phunit = malloc(phn*sizeof(unsigned char*));
00497                         if(!cfg->pmu[j]->phunit) {
00498                                 printf("Not enough memory cfg->pmu[j]->phunit[][]\n");
00499                                 exit(1);
00500                         }
00501                         
00502                         for (i = 0; i < phn; i++) {
00503                                 cfg->pmu[j]->phunit[i] = malloc(5*sizeof(unsigned char));
00504                         }
00505         
00506                         i = 0;
00507                         while(i<phn){ //Separate the Phasor conversion factors
00508                                   copy_cbyc (cfg->pmu[j]->phunit[i],(unsigned char *)s,4);
00509                                   cfg->pmu[j]->phunit[i][4] = '\0';
00510                                   s = s + 4;
00511                                   i++;
00512                         }
00513                   }//if for PHASOR Factors ends
00514         
00515                 //ANALOG FACTORS
00516                   if(ann != 0){
00517         
00518                         cfg->pmu[j]->anunit = malloc(ann*sizeof(unsigned char*));
00519                         if(!cfg->pmu[j]->anunit) {
00520                                 printf("Not enough memory cfg->pmu[j]->anunit[][]\n");
00521                                 exit(1);
00522                         }
00523                 
00524                         for (i = 0; i < ann; i++) {
00525                                 cfg->pmu[j]->anunit[i] = malloc(5*sizeof(unsigned char));
00526 
00527                         }
00528                 
00529                         i = 0;
00530                         while(i<ann){ //Separate the Phasor conversion factors
00531                                   copy_cbyc (cfg->pmu[j]->anunit[i],(unsigned char *)s,4);
00532                                   cfg->pmu[j]->anunit[i][4] = '\0';
00533                                   s = s + 4;
00534                                   i++;
00535                         }
00536                 
00537                   } // if for ANALOG Factors ends
00538                 
00539                   if(dgn != 0){
00540                 
00541                         cfg->pmu[j]->dgunit = malloc(dgn*sizeof(unsigned char*));
00542                         if(!cfg->pmu[j]->dgunit) {
00543                                 printf("Not enough memory cfg->pmu[j]->dgunit[][]\n");
00544                                 exit(1);
00545                         }
00546                 
00547                         for (i = 0; i < dgn; i++) {
00548                                 cfg->pmu[j]->dgunit[i] = malloc(5*sizeof(unsigned char));
00549 
00550                         }
00551                 
00552                         i = 0;
00553                         while(i<dgn){ //Separate the Phasor conversion factors
00554 
00555                                   copy_cbyc (cfg->pmu[j]->dgunit[i],(unsigned char *)s,4);
00556                                   cfg->pmu[j]->dgunit[i][4] = '\0';
00557                                   s = s + 4;
00558                                   i++;
00559                         }
00560                   } //if for Digital Words Factors ends
00561                 
00562                         
00563                   copy_cbyc (cfg->pmu[j]->fnom,(unsigned char *)s,2);
00564                   cfg->pmu[j]->fnom[2]='\0';
00565                   s = s + 2;
00566                 
00567                   copy_cbyc (cfg->pmu[j]->cfg_cnt,(unsigned char *)s,2);
00568                   cfg->pmu[j]->cfg_cnt[2] = '\0';
00569                   s = s + 2;    
00570                   j++;
00571           }//While for PMU number ends
00572                 
00573                 
00574           copy_cbyc (cfg->data_rate,(unsigned char *)s,2);
00575           cfg->data_rate[2] = '\0';
00576           cfg->cfgnext = NULL;
00577           
00578 
00579           if (cfgfirst == NULL)  {
00580                 cfgfirst = cfg; 
00581           } else {
00582 
00583                 struct cfg_frame *t=cfgfirst;
00584                 while(t->cfgnext != NULL){
00585                         t = t->cfgnext;
00586                 }
00587                 t->cfgnext = cfg;
00588           }
00589 
00590 } 
00591 
00592 /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00593 /* FUNCTION  recreate_Connection_Table():                                       */
00594 /* It re-creates objects by reading the file ipaddress.txt. and upperpdc_ip.txt.*/
00595 /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00596 
00597 void recreate_Connection_Table() {
00598 
00599         FILE *f;
00600         char line[40],*ip,*port,*protocol,*id;  
00601         int err;
00602 
00603         // A new thread is created for each TCP connection in 'detached' mode. Thus allowing any number of threads to be created. 
00604         pthread_attr_t attr;
00605         pthread_attr_init(&attr);
00606         if((err = pthread_attr_setdetachstate(&attr, PTHREAD_CREATE_DETACHED))) { 
00607 
00608                 perror(strerror(err));                           
00609                 exit(1);                                        
00610                                                                                 
00611         }                                                               
00612                                                                                                                                                                                                                         if((err = pthread_attr_setschedpolicy(&attr,SCHED_FIFO))) { 
00613 
00614                 perror(strerror(err));               
00615                 exit(1);
00616         }  
00617 
00618         f = fopen("ipaddress.txt","r");
00619         if (f != NULL) { //1 if
00620                 
00621                 printf("####         CONNECTION TABLE OF SOURCE DEVICES        ####\n");
00622                 printf("-----------------------------------------------------------------\n");
00623                 printf("|   PMU ID      |  Lower IP     |       Port    |     Protocol  |\n");
00624                 printf("-----------------------------------------------------------------\n");
00625                 while (fgets (line, 40,f) != NULL) /* read a line */ { //2 while
00626                         
00627                         /* Extract the ip and protocol */ 
00628                         id = strtok (line," ");
00629                         ip = strtok (NULL," ");
00630                         port = strtok (NULL," ");
00631                         protocol = strtok (NULL," ");
00632                         *(protocol+3) = '\0';
00633                         printf("|\t%d\t|%s\t|\t%d\t|\t%s\t|\n",atoi(id),ip,atoi(port),protocol);
00634 
00635                         struct Lower_Layer_Details *temp_pmu;
00636                         temp_pmu = malloc(sizeof(struct Lower_Layer_Details));
00637                         if(!temp_pmu) {
00638 
00639                                 printf("Not enough memory temp_pmu\n");
00640                                 exit(1);
00641 
00642                         }
00643                 
00644                         temp_pmu->pmuid = atoi(id);
00645                         strcpy(temp_pmu->ip,ip);
00646                         temp_pmu->port = atoi(port);
00647                         strcpy(temp_pmu->protocol,protocol);
00648                         temp_pmu->data_transmission_off = 0;
00649                         temp_pmu->pmu_remove = 0;
00650                         temp_pmu->request_cfg_frame = 0;                        
00651                         temp_pmu->next = NULL;
00652                         temp_pmu->prev = NULL;
00653 
00654                         if(!strncasecmp(temp_pmu->protocol,"UDP",3)) {
00655 
00656                                 recreate_udp_connections(temp_pmu);
00657                         }
00658 
00659                         if(!strncasecmp(temp_pmu->protocol,"TCP",3)) {
00660 
00661                                 recreate_tcp_connections(temp_pmu);
00662                         }
00663 
00664                         memset(line,'\0',40);
00665                 }
00666                 printf("-----------------------------------------------------------------\n");
00667                 fclose(f);
00668 
00669         } else {
00670                 
00671                 perror("ipaddress.txt");
00672         }
00673 
00674         f = fopen("upperpdc_ip.txt","r");
00675         if (f != NULL) { //1 if
00676                 
00677                 printf("####  CONNECTION TABLE OF DESTINATION DEVICES  ####\n");
00678                 printf("-------------------------------------------------\n");
00679                 printf("|  Upper IP     |       Port    |     Protocol  |\n");
00680                 printf("-------------------------------------------------\n");
00681                 while(fgets (line, 40,f) != NULL) /* read a line */ { //2 while
00682                         
00683                         /* Extract the ip and protocol */ 
00684                         ip = strtok (line," ");
00685                         port = strtok (NULL," ");
00686                         protocol = strtok (NULL," ");
00687                         *(protocol+3) = '\0';
00688                         printf("|%s\t|\t%d\t|\t%s\t|\n",ip,atoi(port),protocol);
00689 
00690                         struct Upper_Layer_Details *temp_pdc;
00691                         temp_pdc = malloc(sizeof(struct Upper_Layer_Details));
00692                         if(!temp_pdc) {
00693 
00694                                 printf("Not enough memory temp_pmu\n");
00695                                 exit(1);
00696 
00697                         }
00698 
00699                         strcpy(temp_pdc->ip,ip);
00700                         temp_pdc->port = atoi(port);
00701                         strcpy(temp_pdc->protocol,protocol);                    
00702 
00703                         bzero(&temp_pdc->pdc_addr,sizeof(temp_pdc->pdc_addr));
00704                         temp_pdc->pdc_addr.sin_family = AF_INET;
00705                         temp_pdc->pdc_addr.sin_addr.s_addr = inet_addr(temp_pdc->ip);  
00706                         temp_pdc->pdc_addr.sin_port = htons(temp_pdc->port);
00707 
00708                         memset(&(temp_pdc->pdc_addr.sin_zero), '\0', 8);   // zero the rest of the struct
00709                         temp_pdc->config_change = 0;
00710                         temp_pdc->UL_upper_pdc_cfgsent = 0;
00711                         temp_pdc->UL_data_transmission_off = 1;
00712                         temp_pdc->address_set = 0;
00713 
00714                         if(ULfirst == NULL) {
00715         
00716                                 ULfirst = temp_pdc;
00717                                 temp_pdc->prev = NULL;
00718                         
00719                         } else {
00720         
00721                                 ULlast->next = temp_pdc;
00722                                 temp_pdc->prev = ULlast;
00723 
00724                         }
00725         
00726                         ULlast = temp_pdc;
00727                         temp_pdc->next = NULL;
00728                         memset(line,'\0',40);
00729                 }
00730                 printf("-------------------------------------------------\n");
00731                 fclose(f);
00732 
00733         } else {
00734                 
00735                 perror("upperpdc_ip.txt");
00736         }
00737 }
00738 
00739 /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00740 /* FUNCTION  recreate_udp_connections():                                        */
00741 /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00742 
00743 void recreate_udp_connections(struct Lower_Layer_Details *t11) {
00744 
00745         int err;
00746         pthread_attr_t attr;
00747         pthread_attr_init(&attr);
00748         if((err = pthread_attr_setdetachstate(&attr, PTHREAD_CREATE_DETACHED))) { 
00749 
00750                 perror(strerror(err));                           
00751                 exit(1);                                        
00752                                                                                 
00753         }                                                               
00754                                                                                                                                                                                                                         if((err = pthread_attr_setschedpolicy(&attr,SCHED_FIFO))) { 
00755 
00756                 perror(strerror(err));               
00757                 exit(1);
00758         }  
00759 
00760         pthread_t t;
00761 
00762         if(pthread_create(&t,&attr,connect_pmu_udp,(void *)t11)) {
00763                 
00764                 perror(strerror(err));               
00765                 exit(1);
00766         }                                               
00767 }
